title: Internationalization Data from the Unicode CLDR in Tabular Form
text: need get decimal mark grouping separators base German locale "de", cldr_numbers() function used: Need know "LU" territory name "es" locale? Want list days---week names "ko" locale? Need get appropriate display name Japanese Yen ("JPY") currency "zh" locale? like complete set exemplar characters "fi" locale? just small sampling ways can easily get data within CLDR using R!
code: cldr_numbers(locale = "de", element = numbers_elements$decimal) #> [1] "," cldr_numbers(locale = "de", element = numbers_elements$group) #> [1] "," cldr_locale_names(locale = "es", element = locale_names_elements$territory_names)$LU #> [1] "Luxemburgo" cldr_dates(locale = "ko", element = dates_elements$days_standalone_wide) #> $sun #> [1] "ì¼ìš”ì¼" #>  #> $mon #> [1] "ì›”ìš”ì¼" #>  #> $tue #> [1] "í™”ìš”ì¼" #>  #> $wed #> [1] "ìˆ˜ìš”ì¼" #>  #> $thu #> [1] "ëª©ìš”ì¼" #>  #> $fri #> [1] "ê¸ˆìš”ì¼" #>  #> $sat #> [1] "í† ìš”ì¼" cldr_currencies(   locale = "zh",   currency = currency_code_list$JPY,   element = currencies_elements$currency_display_name ) #> [1] "æ—¥å…ƒ" cldr_characters(locale = "fr", element = characters_elements$exemplar_characters) #> [1] "[a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o p q r s Å¡ t u v w x y z Å¾ Ã¥ Ã¤ Ã¶]"

what: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
title: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
text: numbers table contains localized data number-related entities across 571 locales. table 571 rows (one per locale) following 26 columns: locale (character) default_numbering_system (character) other_numbering_systems (named list [variable length]) minimum_grouping_digits (integer) decimal (character) group (character) list (character) percent_sign (character) plus_sign" (character) minus_sign (character) approx_sign (character) exp_sign (character) sup_exp (character) per_mille (character) infinity (character) nan (character) time_sep (character) approx_pattern (character) at_least_pattern (character) at_most_pattern (character) range_pattern (character) decimal_format (character) sci_format (character) percent_format (character) currency_format (character) accounting_format (character) first column, locale, locale name (e.g., "en", "de-", etc.). remaining 25 columns explained separate sections.

title: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
text: object class tbl_df (inherits tbl, data.frame) 571 rows 26 columns.

title: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
text: default_numbering_system (CLDR: 'defaultNumberingSystem') column provides element indicates numbering system used presentation numeric quantities given locale.

title: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
text: other_numbering_systems (CLDR: 'otherNumberingSystems') column provides element defines general categories numbering systems sometimes used given locale formatting numeric quantities. additional numbering systems often used specific contexts, calendars financial purposes. currently three defined categories, follows: native Defines numbering system used native digits, usually defined part script used write language. native numbering system can numeric positional decimal-digit numbering system, using digits General_Category=Decimal_Number. locales native numbering system default, assumed numbering system "latn" ( Western Digits 0-9) always acceptable, can selected using "-nu" keyword part Unicode locale identifier. traditional Defines traditional numerals locale. numbering system may numeric algorithmic. traditional numbering system defined, applications use native numbering system fallback. finance Defines numbering system used financial quantities. numbering system may numeric algorithmic. often used ideographic languages Chinese, easy alter amount represented default numbering system simply adding additional strokes. financial numbering system specified, applications use default numbering system fallback. categories defined numbering systems can used Unicode locale identifier select proper numbering system without know specific numbering system name. select Hindi language using native digits numeric formatting, use locale ID "hi--u-nu-native". select Chinese language using appropriate financial numerals, use locale ID: "zh-u-nu-finance". Tamil language using traditional Tamil numerals, use locale ID "ta-u-nu-traditio". last example, select Arabic language using western digits 0-9, use locale ID "ar-u-nu-latn".

title: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
text: minimum_grouping_digits (CLDR: 'minimumGroupingDigits') value can used suppress groupings certain value. used languages Polish, one write grouping separator values 9999. minimum_grouping_digits value contains default locale.

title: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
text: Number symbols define localized symbols commonly used formatting numbers given locale. symbols can referenced using number formatting pattern. decimal (CLDR: 'decimal') symbol separates integer fractional part number. group (CLDR: 'group') symbol separates clusters integer digits make large numbers legible; commonly used thousands (grouping size 3, e.g. "100,000,000") locales, ten-thousands (grouping size 4, e.g. "1,0000,0000"). may two different grouping sizes: primary grouping size used least significant integer group, secondary grouping size used significant groups; locales (e.g. "12,34,56,789"). pattern contains multiple grouping separators, interval last one end integer defines primary grouping size, interval last two defines secondary grouping size. others ignored, "#,##,###,####" == "###,###,####" == "##,#,###,####". list (CLDR: 'list') symbol used separate numbers list intended represent structured data array. must different decimal value. list separator non-linguistic usage opposed list patterns linguistic lists (e.g. "Bob, Carol, Ted"). plus_sign (CLDR: 'plusSign') preferred symbol expressing positive value minus_sign (CLDR: 'minusSign') negative values. can used produce modified patterns, "3.12" formatted "+3.12", example. standard number patterns (except accounting notation) contain minus_sign, explicitly implicitly. explicit pattern, value plus_sign can substituted value minus_sign produce pattern explicit plus sign. approx_sign (CLDR: 'approximatelySign') element contains symbol used denote approximate value. symbol substituted place minus_sign using semantics plus_sign substitution. exp_sign (CLDR: 'exponential') provides symbol used separating mantissa exponent values. exponential notation sup_exp (CLDR: 'superscriptingExponent') alternatively used show format like "1.23 Ã— 104". superscripting can use markup, <sup>4</sup> HTML, special case Latin digits, use superscripted numeral characters. percent_sign (CLDR: 'percentSign') symbol used indicate percentage (1/100th) amount. present, value might require multiplication 100 formatting. per_mille (CLDR: 'perMille') symbol used indicate per mille (1/1000th) amount. present, value might need multiplied 1000 formatting. infinity sign provided infinity (CLDR: 'infinity') element. nan element (CLDR: 'nan') NaN (number) sign. elements correspond IEEE bit patterns infinity NaN. time_sep (CLDR: 'timeSeparator') pattern allows time format used multiple number systems time separator depends number system. example, time format Arabic colon using Latin numbering system, Arabic numbering system used, traditional time separator older print styles often Arabic comma.

title: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
text: several miscellaneous patterns special purposes. approx_pattern (CLDR: 'approximately') indicates approximate number, : "~99". pattern called at_most_pattern (CLDR: 'atMost') can describe upper limit. indicates , example, 99 items fewer. at_least_pattern (CLDR: 'atLeast') describes lower limit. might "99+" indicate 99 items . range_pattern (CLDR: 'range'), range numbers, "99â€“103", can used indicate 99 103 items.

title: A table with localized numerical attributes and descriptors â€” numbers
text: Number formats used define rules formatting numeric quantities. Different formats provided different contexts. decimal_format (CLDR: 'decimalFormats') prescribed locale-specific way write base 10 number. Variations decimal_format pattern provided allow compact number formatting. percent_format (CLDR: 'percentFormats') pattern use percentage formatting. pattern use scientific (exponent) formatting provided sci_format (CLDR: 'scientificFormats'). pattern use currency formatting found currency_format (CLDR: 'currencyFormats'). format contains additional structural options allow proper placement currency symbol relative numeric quantity. accounting_format (CLDR: 'accountingFormats') pattern used generate accounting-style formatting.
